author: mopqqroo
title: Persisten lluvias y bajas temperaturas en Quintana Roo - Quadratin Quintana Roo
text:
CANCÚN, QRoo, 12 de diciembre de 2024.- El frente frío número 14 mantiene cielo nublado con lluvias fuertes en Quintana Roo, especialmente en el sur del estado. Durante el día se espera clima cálido, mientras que al amanecer será fresco a frío.
En la región, las lluvias han disminuido, con precipitaciones aisladas en Campeche y Yucatán. Además, se registran vientos con rachas de hasta 50 kilómetros por hora en las costas. Se prevé una mejora gradual en las condiciones climáticas.
Cancún: Lluvias ligeras y ambiente fresco
Cielo nublado con lluvias aisladas durante el día. Se esperan vientos moderados con rachas de hasta 50 kilómetros por hora en zonas costeras. Temperaturas de 22 grados Celsius por la mañana y hasta 26 grados Celsius por la tarde.
Tulum: Precipitaciones moderadas y clima cálido
La Dirección General de Protección Civil y Bomberos de Tulum prevé lluvias moderadas a fuertes, especialmente al sur del municipio, con cielos mayormente nublados. El amanecer será fresco con 18 grados Celsius, mientras que las temperaturas durante el día alcanzarán los 27 grados Celsius.
Isla Mujeres: Vientos fuertes y lluvias aisladas
Chubascos aislados con cielo parcialmente nublado. Vientos de hasta 50 kilómetros por hora en las costas. Temperaturas mínimas de 22 grados Celsius al amanecer y máximas de 24 grados Celsius por la tarde.
Solidaridad: Cielo nublado y clima templado
Intervalos de lluvias moderadas, especialmente en áreas cercanas a Playa del Carmen. Cielo nublado durante gran parte del día. Temperaturas frescas de 21 grados Celsius por la mañana y cálidas de hasta 26 grados Celsius en la tarde.

author: María Alejandra Trujillo
title: Kaua'i Unites to Combat Invasive Parakeets: A Pilot Program for Preservation
text:
In an unprecedented move to combat the growing threat to Kaua'i's agriculture and ecosystem, a bill proposing a one-year pilot program aimed at reducing the invasive rose-ringed parakeet population has garnered unanimous support. This legislative action comes in response to the significant damage these birds have inflicted on the island's farming community, devouring seed and fruit crops, thereby causing considerable economic strain. With an allocation of $150,000 dedicated to this initiative, the program represents a concerted effort to address the challenges posed by a species that, since its introduction in 1968, has seen its numbers swell to over 12,500.
The Plight of Kaua'i's Farmers
The picturesque landscape of Kaua'i belies a growing concern among its inhabitants. The rose-ringed parakeet, a species not native to the island, has become a formidable adversary to the local farming community. These birds, known for their striking plumage and raucous calls, have been causing havoc by feasting on a variety of seed and fruit crops. The impact is substantial, with small farms experiencing an average loss of 10% of their yields. This loss not only affects the farmers' livelihoods but also has broader implications for the island's economy and food security.
A Unified Response
The proposed pilot program is a testament to the collaborative spirit of Kaua'i's residents, state and county agencies, and various interest groups. This unity underscores the widespread recognition of the threat posed by the parakeets not only to agriculture but also to the island's environment and quality of life. Beyond the economic ramifications, the birds' behavior, including mass roosting, loud calls, and the accumulation of droppings, has become a nuisance to residents and the resort industry alike. Furthermore, the parakeets' potential to spread invasive seeds, displace native bird species, and transmit avian diseases adds an environmental urgency to the initiative.
Empowering Citizens Through Science
In an innovative approach to tackling the parakeet problem, the Kaua'i Office of Economic Development has introduced a 'citizen science' mapping tool. This platform enables residents to contribute to the collection of crucial data on the birds' population and movements. By harnessing the power of community observation, authorities aim to gain a better understanding of the parakeets' habits and habitats. This information will be invaluable in devising strategies to mitigate their impact and protect Kaua'i's precious natural resources. The program not only empowers citizens to play an active role in safeguarding their environment but also fosters a deeper connection between the community and the land they call home.
In conclusion, the unanimous approval of the bill to launch a pilot program addressing the rose-ringed parakeet invasion on Kaua'i marks a significant milestone in the island's environmental management efforts. By allocating $150,000 towards reducing the parakeet population, the initiative aims to alleviate the economic and ecological pressures exerted by these invasive birds. With the support of the entire community, from farmers and residents to government agencies and conservationists, there is a collective hope for a sustainable resolution to the challenges posed by the rose-ringed parakeets. As the program unfolds, it will be a testament to the power of collaborative action in preserving the beauty and vitality of Kaua'i for future generations.

author: 20 Minuten
title: Getta cloro nel laghetto, fa strage di pesci
text:
L'intenzione era quella di mantenere pulita la sua piscina naturale. Ma non ha tenuto conto delle conseguenze per le acque vicine.
UETIKON - Le conseguenze per i fiumi Scheidbach e Mühlebach sono state significative: in totale sono morti 69 pesci in un tratto di 1,2 chilometri. Il motivo? L'acqua era contaminata dal cloro. Ciò è stato causato da una donna di Uetikon (ZH) che intendeva disinfettare l'acqua del suo laghetto naturale.
La donna è stata condannata a una multa sospesa con la condizionale di 35 aliquote giornaliere da 120 franchi e a una multa di 500 franchi per violazione colposa della legge federale sulla protezione delle acque, maltrattamento di animali e violazione della legge sui prodotti chimici. A ciò si aggiungono le spese processuali pari a 1'700 franchi, come riporta il “Tages-Anzeiger”.
Ma come si è verificato questo incidente? A quanto pare la donna voleva pulire il suo laghetto naturale balneabile e pensava che i granuli di cloro Planet Pool fossero il prodotto giusto. Ciò che non ha considerato è che è un prodotto pensato per le piscine, non per i laghetti naturali balneabili. Come se non bastasse, lo ha anche utilizzato in una concentrazione decisamente troppo elevata: il contenuto di cloro era 75 volte superiore a quello delle piscine pubbliche e 260 volte superiore al valore indicativo per l'acqua corrente. Ogni mese gettava nello stagno mezzo chilo di granuli.
È chiaro che non lo abbia fatto con cattive intenzioni. Il problema è che nel momento in cui ha notato che iniziavano a crescere delle alghe, ha anche pensato che il cloro non funzionasse più. Così ha prosciugato l'acqua dal suo laghetto. Che si è riversata, tramite le fognature, nei corsi d'acqua. Con le conseguenze sopra descritte.
Non è dato sapere se la donna si sia avvelenata a sua volta facendo il bagno nell'acqua contaminata. Secondo l'ordinanza penale, si era praticamente immersa in un disinfettante puro.

author: world today news
title: The Czech Republic joins the worldwide drone coalition to assist Ukraine
text:
On Thursday, July 11, the Czech Republic joined the drone coalition led by the UK and Latvia in assist of Ukraine, and its delegation signed the coalition’s memorandum of understanding at a summit NATO’s seventy fifth anniversary in Washington.
“I’m very happy with the dedication of the Czech Republic to affix the drone coalition to assist Ukraine within the combat towards Russian residents. All members of the coalition contribute considerably not solely to the assist of Ukraine, but additionally to the event of the army trade itself,” mentioned Protection Minister Andris Spruds.
With the Czech Republic becoming a member of the drone coalition, 16 member states will cooperate in it.
It has already been reported that so as to coordinate cooperation, the event of drone applied sciences and their use each to assist Ukraine and to strengthen the protection capabilities of the member states, in the course of the NATO summit, members despatched The drone coalition signed a memorandum of understanding.
Members of the drone coalition have already offered vital assist to Ukraine by way of drone deliveries. Latvia has put aside 20 million euros for drone coalition objectives this 12 months, and in addition offers drone testing alternatives for producers and the armed forces to constantly develop drone applied sciences.
Together with Latvia, the UK, Australia, the Czech Republic, Denmark, France, Estonia, Italy, New Zealand, Canada, Lithuania, the Netherlands, Poland, Ukraine, Germany and Sweden participates within the drone coalition.
This info is a public launch and doesn’t mirror the opinion of the LV portal. The sender is answerable for his content material. Phrases of publication 2024-07-12 06:27:51
#Czech #Republic #joins #worldwide #drone #coalition #assist #Ukraine

author: UOL
title: Grupos ambientalistas e indígenas do Equador ameaçam agir contra campo petrolífero amazônico
text:
Grupos ambientalistas e indígenas do Equador ameaçam agir contra campo petrolífero amazônico
Por Alexandra Valencia
QUITO (Reuters) - Ambientalistas e grupos indígenas do Equador disseram nesta quinta-feira que o presidente Daniel Noboa corre o risco de ser destituído do cargo se não cumprir um referendo que exigiu o fechamento de um bloco de petróleo na região amazônica do país.
No ano passado, a maioria dos equatorianos votou pelo fechamento do bloco 43-ITT para proteger a reserva Yasuni na Amazônia, e o tribunal superior do país concedeu um ano para a remoção da infraestrutura de petróleo na região.
Recentemente, Noboa ventilou a ideia de adiar o fechamento do bloco, citando como motivo os recursos necessários para financiar a ofensiva militar declarada por ele para combater as gangues criminosas que ele designou como terroristas em meio à violência crescente.
A estatal Petroecuador já havia dito anteriormente que o fechamento do bloco -- que produz cerca de 55.000 barris de petróleo por dia -- poderia ser iniciado em agosto.
"Se o presidente assinar um documento declarando que não cumprirá a vontade do povo..., o Tribunal Constitucional terá que remover o presidente, nós nos encarregaremos de apresentar acusações criminais", disse a jornalistas Pedro Bermeo, do grupo de defesa ambiental Yasunidos, que trabalhou pelo referendo.
Durante a mesma entrevista coletiva, Leonidas Iza, presidente do maior grupo indígena do Equador, a Conaie, ameaçou levar o caso ao tribunal superior do Equador e à Comissão Interamericana de Direitos Humanos (CIDH), se necessário.
"Os democratas respeitam a vontade do povo", disse Iza. "Os oportunistas se aproveitam da vontade do povo para seus próprios fins. O presidente Noboa está no ponto de revelar se é um oportunista ou um democrata."
O governo não respondeu a pedidos de comentários.
O fechamento do bloco pode custar ao Equador cerca de 13,8 bilhões de dólares nas próximas duas décadas e resultará na perda de 12% da produção de petróleo do país, de cerca de 492.000 bpd, de acordo com a Petroecuador.
(Reportagem de Alexandra Valencia)

author: staff@thelist.com (Shreya Mali)
title: Why Brad Pitt's Romance With Ines De Ramon Is Different From His Past Relationships
text: Why Brad Pitt's Romance With Ines De Ramon Is Different From His Past Relationships Brad Pitt's dating history is chock full of some of the biggest names in Hollywood. However, after having committed relationships with Gwyneth Paltrow, Jennifer Aniston, and Angelina Jolie over the years, Pitt seems to have given up on dating A-listers. Following a reported brief fling with Emily Ratajkowski, Pitt broke his cycle of dating models and movie stars and got [a relationship with jewelry designer Ines de Ramon,](https://www.thelist.com/1220133/all-the-details-about-brad-pitts-relationship-with-ines-de-ramon/) who previously had a 3-year marriage to "The Vampire Diaries" star Paul Wesley. "The Se7en" actor and de Ramon first sparked dating rumors after fans saw them enjoying a Bono concert in November 2022. A day later, a source told [People](https://people.com/movies/brad-pitt-ines-de-ramon-have-been-dating-for-a-few-months-exclusive/) that their relationship had started a few months ago, and common friends had introduced them. Another insider said, "It's not an exclusive relationship. Ines is cute, fun, and energetic. She has a great personality. Brad enjoys spending time with her." However, it seems like their romance took a more serious turn in December 2023 when de Ramon joined Pitt at the premiere of "Babylon." Shortly after that, an insider told [Us Weekly](https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/brad-pitt-smitten-with-ines-de-ramon-as-they-spend-time-together/) that de Ramon and Pitt still hadn't decided to get into a committed relationship, but things were looking up because the "Fight Club" actor had fallen for her after spending loads of time together. They added that Pitt "wasn't expecting to find someone so extraordinary like Ines." While de Ramon might have tons of extraordinary qualities, few attracted Pitt quite as much as her normalcy, which might be the reason why she's been his first serious relationship since Jolie. Brad Pitt loves that Ines de Ramon isn't starstruck by him In January 2024, an insider shared the secret to Brad Pitt and Ines de Ramon's thriving year-long relationship with [OK!.](https://okmagazine.com/p/brad-pitt-girlfriend-ines-de-ramon-isnt-industry-unfazed-celebrity/) "He appreciates that Ines isn't in the industry," they explained. "And she seems totally unfazed by his celebrity." They also said that Pitt and de Ramon found it easy to bond over their shared passion for art and ignited each other's creative spark. As a result, they have an uncomplicated romance, which is which is just what the doctor ordered after their previously messy marriages. Another source shared similar sentiments with [OK!](https://okmagazine.com/p/brad-pitt-girlfriend-ines-de-ramon-breath-fresh-air-actor-family-drama/) in 2023, revealing that de Ramon came as a welcome change to Pitt's dating life. They revealed that de Ramon had been a terrific support system for Pitt as he went through a highly-publicized divorce and dealt with his [strained relationship with his six children.](https://www.thelist.com/1226929/details-about-brad-pitts-relationship-with-his-6-children/) De Ramon reportedly found it easy to relate to Pitt's struggles because she had been in the same boat with her ex-husband. However, it seems like they both learned from their past experiences, as the source claimed that Pitt and de Ramon never get into explosive fights and instead have calm discussions to iron out conflicts. Given how well things are going, it's possible that the couple could end up getting married in the future, but the insider clarified that the couple isn't rushing into things. That makes sense, especially given that neither will want to make the same mistakes again that they made in their previous marriages Brad Pitt doesn't want another messy divorce A separate source close to Brad Pitt shared his plans with Ines de Ramon for the future, telling [RadarOnline](https://radaronline.com/p/brad-pitt-ready-to-marry-ines-de-ramon-prenup/), "Brad is head-over-heels in love with Ines and wants to marry her. He isn't taking any chances this time. Brad is going to insist that Ines sign a rock-solid prenup to protect as much as $650 million in his assets and future holdings." The insider was, of course, referring to [all the drama surrounding Angelina Jolie and Pitt's winery,](https://www.thelist.com/1437159/all-drama-surrounding-angelina-jolie-brad-pitt-winery/) which has cost a fortune in legal fees and payments. Although the divorce scarred Pitt and Jolie, the "Bullet Train" actor seems to be taking small steps towards creating a long-lasting relationship with de Ramon. In October 2023, an insider told [Us Weekly](https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/brad-pitt-ines-de-ramon-are-stronger-than-ever-1-year-into-romance/) that Pitt's nearest and dearest had grown closer to de Ramon because the couple didn't want to spend their limited free time apart. However, the Pitt didn't want to jump the gun and introduce de Ramon to his kids right away because he wanted to ensure the relationship was built to last. As of May 2023, the couple had already professed their love, per [Us Weekly.](https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/brad-pitt-ines-de-ramons-romance-is-not-slowing-down/) While Pitt hadn't sworn off marriage at that point, they still had a long way to get to that point because they didn't feel ready to live together at the time. Still, that doesn't mean that "The Big Short" actor isn't taking the relationship seriously because he has continued to prioritize de Ramon despite his packed schedule.

author: Jeremy Brener
title: Washington Wizards Guard Among All-Star Vote Leaders
text:
Wizards Guard Among All-Star Vote Leaders
The NBA All-Star Game is set to take place next month, and there may be a representative from the Washington Wizards.
The league released another update on All-Star voting and Wizards guard Jordan Poole ranks ninth among Eastern Conference backcourt players with just over 337,000 votes.
The players with more votes than Poole are Darius Garland (Cleveland Cavaliers), Cade Cunningham (Detroit Pistons), Tyrese Maxey (Philadelphia 76ers), Trae Young (Atlanta Hawks), Jalen Brunson (New York Knicks), Damian Lillard (Milwaukee Bucks), Donovan Mitchell (Cleveland Cavaliers) and LaMelo Ball (Charlotte Hornets), who has nearly two million votes.
Poole has played well enough to warrant consideration for his first All-Star appearance. He is averaging 21.5 points per game, which marks a career-high for him.
The fan votes determine the starting lineup while the rest of the team is chosen by the coaches. Therefore, it is still very unlikely for the Wizards to see Poole make it to the All-Star Game, but to see him in the top group of contenders should definitely make Washington happy.
Poole is being tasked with taking on the responsibilities of a leading scorer for a team that doesn't have very many scoring weapons, and he is taking the job on board like a champ.
The Wizards haven't made much progress this season, but they would be much further back if it weren't for Poole's efforts.
Poole is only 25 years old, but if he can continue pushing forward to become a stronger scorer, the Wizards guard could be well on pace to become an All-Star as long as the team around him improves as well.
Poole and the Wizards are back in action tonight as they take on the Phoenix Suns. Tipoff is scheduled for 7 p.m. ET inside Capital One Arena.
Make sure you bookmark Washington Wizards on SI for the latest news, exclusive interviews, film breakdowns and so much more!

author: Ana Plaza
title: El chiringuito de Málaga que es el favorito de la reina Sofía: en primera línea de playa y especializado en espetos y fritura - Infobae
text:
El chiringuito de Málaga que conquistó a la Reina Sofía (Montaje Infobae) Fue durante la Semana Santa del pasado 2024 cuando la reina Sofía volvió a demostrar su aprecio por Málaga, visitando la ciudad en diversos actos oficiales. Una vez finalizados sus compromisos, doña Sofía quiso disfrutar del buen tiempo de la costa malagueña en uno de sus chiringuitos más icónicos: Rocamar, en el barrio de Huelin . De hecho, este local ya se ha ganado el título a su chiringuito favorito de Málaga , pues no era la primera vez que Sofía aprovecha una visita para comer en sus mesas.
“Una vez más, ha vuelto doña Sofía a degustar nuestros platos, haciendo especial mención a nuestros espetos de sardinas y dándole personalmente la enhorabuena a nuestro espetero”, escribían desde el restaurante en una publicación de su perfil de Instagram, un vídeo en el que se veía a la emérita recorriendo el salón y saludando a los trabajadores.
Ubicado a escasos metros de la playa, en pleno Paseo Marítimo Antonio Machado , Rocamar es ya todo un clásico en la zona, un lugar casi de peregrinaje para aquellos que buscan disfrutar de la cocina malagueña más tradicional. Sus maravillosas vistas al mar y su decoración, que nos remite a una cabaña marinera de las de siempre, son dos de sus grandes atractivos, aunque también lo es sin duda su cocina, esa que consiguió conquistar a la reina en varias de sus visitas.
Qué se come en Rocamar La carta de Rocamar hace un repaso completo a los platos más típicos de la cocina local. Los espetos de sardinas , jugosos y asados al estilo típico de la costa, con sal y limón, ocupan un lugar central en su oferta. Junto a ellos, la fritura malagueña y los arroces caldosos , como el arroz con bogavante, destacan entre las especialidades. La variedad de mariscos incluye almejas salteadas, vieiras, conchas finas y carabineros, todos seleccionados por su frescura y calidad. Entre los entrantes, la porra antequerana, las croquetas caseras y la pipirrana de pulpo ofrecen un recorrido por los sabores tradicionales de la región.
Espetos en el chiringuito Rocamar, en Málaga (Instagram / @chiringuitorocamaroficial) La carta no se limita al pescado y marisco. Para quienes prefieren la carne, el local propone hamburguesas, entrecot, presa ibérica y pechuga de pollo, ampliando así su atractivo a todo tipo de comensales. Las ensaladas frescas, las raciones de adobo, salmonetitos, calamaritos y boquerones completan una oferta que busca satisfacer tanto a turistas como a los clientes habituales.
Todas estas recetas, elaboradas con mimo y producto de calidad, han hecho de Rocamar un clásico de la zona para muchos. De hecho, la Guía Repsol ha incluido al chiringuito entre sus recomendaciones, y el chef malagueño José Carlos García lo ha señalado como uno de sus favoritos de la ciudad, otorgándole un Solete Repsol y definiéndolo como un lugar donde “saborear el Mediterráneo”.
Además de los salones del interior, Rocamar cuenta con una amplia terraza cubierta desde donde contemplar las mejores vistas del Mediterráneo. En temporada alta, el local abre todos los días de 10:00 a 00:00 horas y el precio medio oscila entre los 20 y 30 euros por comensal.

author: NL Times
title: Many last-minute skiing vacations booked after early snowfall
text: Many last-minute skiing vacations booked after early snowfall Many winter sports enthusiasts have booked last-minute ski vacations this month due to heavy snowfall at the beginning of December, according to travel organizations TUI and Sunweb. TUI says that due to the snowfall, the number of bookings is five percent higher than in December of last year. Sunweb, the biggest provider of winter sports holidays, has seen more people booking earlier this year. According to a TUI spokesperson, destinations in Austria are the most popular for winter sports, followed by France and Italy. "Italy has had a big growth of 20 percent compared to last year." According to her, the growing interest in a winter sports holiday in Italy may be because more and more people are looking for a more original destination than, for example, Austria. She said there has also been more interest in ski vacations in Sweden and Norway. Skiing vacations in Scandinavian countries come with potential extra activities like, for example, a husky tour. "The spokesperson said that the certainty of snow and the child-friendly skiing areas are why many people choose this place as a destination," said the spokesperson. The amount of bookings at Sunweb has been around the same as last year, said a spokesperson. "In the first week of December, we saw that the bookings at the French skiing resorts were 30 percent higher than last year." She said that because the snow fell early in the winter sports season, some ski resorts opened earlier. Destinations in Austria are also popular with Sunweb, "the large, high-altitude areas with a certainty of snow."

author: Redacción y EFE
title: El papa Francisco hizo una donación de 200 000 euros de su cuenta personal para ayudar a una cárcel
text:
Antes de su muerte, el pasado lunes, el papa Francisco realizó una donación personal de 200 000 euros destinada a los presos, en lo que eran “sus últimas posesiones”, aseguró este miércoles el obispo Benoni Ambarus, director de la oficina para la pastoral carcelaria y encargado de asuntos caritativos en Roma.
“Les donó 200.000 euros de su cuenta personal”.
Según concretó, esta donación fue destinada a una fábrica de pasta del centro penitenciario para menores Casal del Marmo, en Roma.
“Le dije que tenemos una hipoteca cuantiosa para esta fábrica de pasta y que si conseguíamos cubrirla bajaríamos los precios de la pasta, venderíamos más y podríamos contratar más chicos”.
Ambarus además destacó la defensa que hizo Francisco de los presos durante su papado.
Lea: Filippo Sorcinelli, el diseñador que vistió al papa Francisco hasta su último día
Y mencionó la reciente visita del papa a la cárcel romana de Regina Coeli este pasado jueves, en motivo del Jueves Santo y apenas cuatro días antes de su muerte, donde “gritó al mundo, con todas sus fueras, la necesidad de prestar atención a los presos”.
Durante sus pocos más de 12 años de pontificado, el papa visitó usualmente centros penitenciarios e instó a defender la dignidad de los presos.
Le puede interesar: 5 símbolos del féretro del papa Francisco que ya reposa en la Basílica de San Pedro
El pasado diciembre, en motivo del inicio de las celebraciones del Jubileo o Año Santo, Francisco abrió una de las puertas santas para este evento que el Vaticano celebra cada 25 años en la cárcel de Rebibbia de Roma, lo que fue interpretado como una declaración de intenciones y un signo de su reconocimiento a la población presa.
